title: Who is Firon? How did he die? - Quora

response.answer_text: NOTE: I am using the Islamic argument because the word Fir’awn was used in the question, a word specifically used in the Qur’an. If you would like an alternative answer that is not founded in religion, please leave a comment and I’ll get back to you. Fir'awn is the Arabic for Pharoah, as used in the Qur’an several times in the narration of the story of Musa (Moses) peace be upon him. Historians have attributed the Pharaoah at the time of Moses to be many people - Merneptah particularly, given that there is the Merneptah Stele which is the only Ancient Egyptian document to mention the Israelites. However, other pharaohs who have been suggested include Ramesses the Great (Ramesses II) because of how the Qur’an states Fir’awn died (I’m using the Yusuf Ali translation): "This day shall We save thee in the body, that thou mayest be a sign to those who come after thee! but verily, many among mankind are heedless of Our Signs!" (Qur’an 10:92) Ramesses II has been extremely well-preserved:  And as a result of this, many people believe Fir’awn to be him. However, this is speculation - we do not have any concrete evidence to prove the identity of Fir’awn. Personally, if God wanted us to know he would have given us a name, and there’s another verse in the Qur’an that might be worth considering (yes, some may say it’s not relevant because it’s in relation to another affair but what it’s saying is don’t speculate): (Some) say they were three, the dog being the fourth among them; (others) say they were five, the dog being the sixth,- doubtfully guessing at the unknown; (yet others) say they were seven, the dog being the eighth. Say thou: "My Lord knoweth best their number; It is but few that know their (real case)." Enter not, therefore, into controversies concerning them, except on a matter that is clear, nor consult any of them about (the affair of) the Sleepers. (Qur’an 18:22). Hope that helps!

Fhirauwn (Pharaoh) was the ruler of Egypt during the time of Prophet Moosa -peace be on him.  And [recall] when We parted the sea for you (Moses) and saved you and drowned the people of Pharaoh while you were looking on. Al-Qur'aan 2:50    But We will this day deliver you with your body that you may  be a sign to those after you, and most surely the majority of the people are heedless to Our communications. Al-Qur'aan 28:40]  And  We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh and his  soldiers pursued them in tyranny and enmity until, when drowning  overtook him, he said, "I believe that there is no deity except that in  whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims."Now? And you had disobeyed [Him] before and were of the corrupters?So  today We will save you in body that you may be to those who succeed you  a sign. While in this state he said, "I believe that there is no deity except that in  whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims." Note: Fhirauwn was speaking inside the sea waves for which the present day scientists would discard it because it is impossible.
